description.value:
Totem of Griffin

Totem Spirit (Respect) — Creation Cost: 8 Gnosis

Spirit Aspect: Vigilance / Guardianship / Sacred Watch

Recommended Umbra Spirits (CR 8+)

To bind Griffin, the pack must confront a spirit that embodies eternal watchfulness and the duty to guard what matters. Suitable spirits include:

  • Elder Watch-Griffin Spirit (Griffin Aspect) — Suggested base: Guardian Griffin–style spirit (CR 10–12), reflavored as a pure Umbra sentinel
  • Celestial Watcher Spirit — Suggested base: Gynosphinx or Androsphinx (CR 11–13), stripped of celestial allegiance and treated as a spirit of guardianship
  • Skyward Sentinel Spirit — Suggested base: Stone Golem–like spirit (CR 10), given flight and heightened perception

These spirits are stern but fair. They respect duty, discipline, and unwavering attention.

Individual Trait

The creature who touches the Totem gains the following benefit until the next long rest:

  • You gain advantage on Wisdom (Perception) and Wisdom (Insight) checks
  • You cannot be surprised while conscious
  • When you roll initiative, you may add +2 to the result

Only one creature may benefit from this trait at a time.

Pack Trait

As an action, a creature touching the Totem may invoke Griffin's watch.

For 1 minute, while within 30 feet of the Totem:

  • Pack members gain advantage on initiative rolls
  • The first attack made against each pack member during the duration is made with disadvantage

This represents Griffin's warning cry and coordinated defensive response.

Ban — Eternal Vigilance

Griffin demands unwavering watchfulness.

The pack must not neglect guard, watch, or reconnaissance duties, when vigilance is reasonably possible.

If the pack is surprised due to willful negligence or disregard for watchfulness, the Totem becomes dormant and all its benefits cease.

To restore the Totem, the pack leader must reinvest the required Gnosis cost to reaffirm the bond.

If the pack repeatedly or egregiously violates this Ban, Griffin may withdraw entirely, permanently severing itself from the Totem at the Storyteller's discretion.

Totem rules: Only one Totem per pack; benefits do not stack; a dormant Totem provides no benefits. Once a Totem benefit is used, it cannot be used again until after a long rest. Interacting with a Totem requires 1 action while touching it; choose either the Individual Trait or the Pack Trait.
